name: Becky Shasta Daisy
climate: Becky Shasta Daisy thrives in temperate climates, ideally found in USDA zones 5 to 9.
It prefers a climate with moderate to cool temperatures and distinct seasons.
This plant can tolerate mild frost but thrives best in warmer summer conditions.
High humidity is not ideal; it prefers areas with good air circulation.
sunlight: Becky Shasta Daisy requires full sun exposure to bloom optimally and healthily.
At least six hours of direct sun per day will ensure vibrant, abundant flowers.
It can tolerate partial shade but with reduced flowering and lushness.
In hot summer regions, partial afternoon shade can prevent sunburn damage.
watering: Regular watering is essential, especially in dry periods, to keep the soil moist.
The plant benefits from deep watering, allowing the soil to dry slightly between sessions.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure soil has good drainage capacity.
In well-drained soil, water the plant deeply about once a week or as needed.
soil: Becky Shasta Daisy flourishes in well-drained, sandy or loamy soils.
The soil should be rich in organic matter to provide adequate nutrients.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH between 6.0 and 6.5 is recommended.
Ensuring proper drainage is critical to prevent disease and waterlogging.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent flowers can promote further blooming and a tidier plant.
Dividing the plants every two to three years enhances growth and vigor.
Mulching around the base can help retain moisture and suppress weeds.
Watch for pests such as aphids and manage with organic insecticidal soap.
